meanings.definition: (obsolete) To encumber; to perplex; to confuse.
meanings.english_definition: (obsolete) To encumber; to perplex; to confuse.

etymology.value: From Middle English *feutren*, *fetren* (“to put in fetters, shackle”), from Old French *feutrer* (“to pad, stuff”), from *feutre* (“felt”), from Medieval Latin *feltrum*, from Proto-Germanic *feltaz* (“felt”).

usage_notes.explanation: "Feuter" is an obsolete verb, meaning to encumber, perplex, or confuse. It is rarely encountered in modern English.

readability_explanation.text: This word is obsolete and not in common usage.
